question: If A and B are two matrices such that $AB=B$ and $BA=A$, then $A^{2}+B^{2}=$
explanation: Multiply first by A: $A(AB) = AB \Rightarrow A^2B = B$. Also $A^2 = A(BA) = (AB)A = BA = A$. So $A^2 = A$.
Multiply second by B: $B(BA) = BA \Rightarrow B^2A = A$. Also $B^2 = B(AB) = (BA)B = AB = B$. So $B^2 = B$.
